definition: to be busy rushing about/to bustle about
to go to/to head for/towards
to hurry/to rush/to run quickly/to elope
busy/hurriedly/to hurry/to rush

sentences.english: The cheerleaders bustled about excitingly before their performance.
sentences.chinese: 拉拉隊長們在演出前興奮地奔忙着。

sentences.english: But as summer approaches, these animals struggle to eke out an existence.
sentences.chinese: 當夏季來臨，這些動物都在爲生存而奔忙。

sentences.english: She bustled about trying to wait on two customers at once.
sentences.chinese: 她到處奔忙，極力同時伺候兩位顧客。

sentences.english: Give God a chance to provide before you go out and charge it.
sentences.chinese: 給神一個機會來供應你，然後你再出去奔忙。

sentences.english: On an average day, he would serve anywhere between three and five hundred cups of tea.
sentences.chinese: 通常的日子裏，他要在三五百隻茶杯之間來回奔忙。

sentences.english: When walking into the dark underpass, busy for your living.
sentences.chinese: 走出這地下漆黑的路，爲生活奔忙。

sentences.english: Find out information easily while on the go.
sentences.chinese: 四處奔忙的時候輕鬆查找信息。

sentences.english: Always hustle and bustle in every corner of the earth.
sentences.chinese: 天各一方的奔忙總是漫長。

definition: to rush about/to be constantly on the move
to run this way and that (idiom); to rush about busily/to bustle about/to hopscotch/also 東跑西顛|东跑西颠[dong1 pao3 xi1 dian1]
to rush about on errands/to be kept on the run
busy/bustling
to work hard/to toil
to travel or work through night and day/to toil away for long hours
to leave early and return late (idiom)
to run/to rush about/to be on the go
see 起早貪黑|起早贪黑[qi3 zao3 tan1 hei1]
to be industrious, rising early and going to bed late
to run this way and that (idiom); to rush about busily/to bustle about
(idiom) terribly busy/up to one's ears in work
to work hard/to look after
hurried/in a haste
laborious
to toil/hard work
